beer.beer_description: Our take on a traditional Quebecois style of beer. In response to customer requests for a darker beer than our popular Pale Ale, we have come up with a flavourful blend of dark roasted malts and spicy hops for an unforgettably smooth and aromatic drinking experience!

beer.beer_name: He'Brew Death Of A Contract Brewer
beer.beer_description: Coming into 17 years of beer, and Year with our own Brewery, we commemorate this conversio with Death Of A Contract Brewer, our Shmaltz homage to new life — L’Chaim!

The St.Bernardus Abt 12 is the pride of our stable, the nec plus ultra of our brewery. Abbey ale brewed in the classic 'Quadrupel' style of Belgium's best Abbey Ales. Dark with a full, ivory-colored head. It has a fruity aroma, full of complex flavours and excells because of its long bittersweet finish with a hoppy bite. (10,0% ABV) Worldwide seen as one of the best beers in the world. It's a very balanced beer, with a full-bodied taste and a perfect equilibrium between malty, bitter and sweet. One of the original recipes from the days of license-brewing for the Trappist monks of Westvleteren

beer.beer_name: Brews Brothers Smokestack Lightning India Pale Ale
Brews Brothers One Bourbon. One Scotch. One Beer Barrel Aged Smoked Scotch Ale
beer.beer_description: Barrel aged smoked Scotch ale. Collaboration with Firehall Brewery

beer.beer_name: Brews Brothers Hound Dog Belgian India Pale Ale
Brews Brothers Backdoor Man Basil India Pale Ale
Brews Brothers Boom Boom Boom Triple Hop Belgian Tripel
Brews Brothers Les Portes Du Pénitencier Black Table Saison
beer.beer_description: Black table saison brewed in collaboration with Townsite brewing.

beer.beer_name: Brews Brothers House of the Rising Sun Table Saison

beer.beer_description: At Pilsner we have not changed since our beer was first brewed in 1926. Why? It's right there on the bottle…. "old style". Those are more than just words on a beloved label. Being true to who we are has kept our drinkers loyal and kept Pilsner from being a fad.

(White of Chambly) was the first bottle
refermented ale produced by Unibroue. It is
brewed from a blend of pale barley malt,
wheat malt and unmalted wheat, to which
we blend selected spices and hops.
 
Blanche de Chambly is only partially filtered,
retaining its natural cloud of yeast that is
characteristic of the original white ales
brewed during the Middle Ages.

We recommend this remarkably refreshing

Barley Wines aged in Malaga port barrels.

Brewed at Fanø Bryghus, Denmark.

beer.beer_name: Stone Smoked Porter w/ Vanilla Bean
beer.beer_description: Stone Smoked Porter w/ Vanilla Bean was the brainchild of Small Batch Brewer Laura Ulrich, who had a stroke of genius after trying Stone Smoked Porter poured over a couple scoops of vanilla ice cream. The complex flavor of Madagascar vanilla beans melds perfectly with the chocolatey, malty, coffee-like character of the beer, making it almost like a liquid dessert, but without an overbearing sweetness.
En Imperial India Pale Ale brygget på: vand, malt (maris otter, munich og cara-munich), flækket havre, humle (herkules, warrior, centennial, amarillo, simcoe og columbus) og alegær.

Last summer we teamed up with San Diego’s Ballast Point for a hop-head twist on a crisp lager. We remixed this encore which is loaded with whole-cone hops in the brew kettle in our Hop Torpedo to deliver a bold aroma back by smooth malt flavor.

The Chimay Blue Cap, "baptized' "Grande Reserve" in 750 ml bottles is a dark Trappist beer with a powerful aroma, the complex flavour of which improves across the years. It was first brewed as a Christmas beer, explaining the presence of a "vintage".

This authentic Belgian beer, whose tinge of fresh yeast is associated with a light rosy flowery touch, is particularly pleasant. Its aroma, perceived as one enjoys it, only accents the delightful sensations revealed by the odour, all revealing a light but agreeable caramelized note. 

It is served ideally at cellar temperature (10 to 12°C).

brewery.brewery_name: Bières de Chimay (Abbaye Notre Dame de Scourmont)
Bières de Chimay (Abbaye Notre Dame de Scourmont)

beer.beer_description: Équinoxe du Printemps (French for "spring equinox") is the quintessential marriage of two great traditions: beer brewing in Scotland, and maple syrup production in Quebec. At the first draught, the mouth is overcome by woody, malty flavors, sustained by a discrete touch of sweetness. The aftertaste brings about the flavors of maple, which are sufficiently present to be appreciated, but never overwhelming the typical flavors of a Scotch Ale.

"...like hot chicks on the beach."

A classic robust porter spiced with all natural toasted coconut.  It is black in color and crowned with a creamy, dark tan head. It begins with a malty-toasted coconut aroma followed by a rich, silky feel with tastes of dark malt, chocolate, and hints of coffee.  It then finishes with flavors of  toasted coconut and hoppy spice to balance the finish.
